name: Professor Blockwell
quote: Remember, the best way to score runs is to not lose your wicket... ever!
caption: Former ODI “batsman” with a strike rate of 37.8 (rounded up at his request). Once batted an entire day for 42 not out. Has never hit a six — on purpose. Currently runs a masterclass titled *The Power of Letting the Bowler Win Emotionally*.

name: Sir Defend-A-Lot
quote: Why rush? The scoreboard can wait. Your survival is paramount.
caption: Turns wides and free hits into dot balls, convinced they’re psychological bait. Known for batting 10 overs without scoring, yet claiming “he set the platform.” His favorite shot? The leave.

name: Runn Leaker
quote: Line and length is overrated. It’s time for vibes and chaos.
caption: Inventor of vibe bowling™, where the arm moves but the brain clocks out. Once went for 64 in 3 overs and called it 'a tactical destabilization.' Has never followed a field setting in his life.

name: Sir Wild Armstrong
quote: If they can’t hit it, they can’t score any runs!(bowls a wide)
caption: A renegade fast bowler-turned-coach who once got banned for bowling bouncers in a charity match. Now spends his time preaching the gospel of 'maximum aggression.' Most comfortable when the umpire’s arms are up for wide signals.

name: Vince Thompson
quote: You can get hurt if balls meet balls. But make sure your drip is fire.
caption: Thompson pioneered The Tactical Collapse™ — Has a 100% drop rate, but 0% blame — thanks to his elite collapsing technique and ability to instantly grab his hamstring after each fumble.

name: Coach Gary Barlow
quote: Stumping is optional. Wasting the team’s reviews is not.
caption: A master of appealing for LBWs on balls pitched outside leg and still climbing, Barlow once burned all 3 reviews within 5 overs — and called it 'psychological warfare.' Teaches keepers to appeal first, check later, and never admit you didn’t hear a nick.
